author: chron.com
title: Review: At B&B Butchers, some steakhouse classics sizzle, others fizzle -
text:
Photo: Dave Rossman, Freelance Image 1 of / 15 15 The USDA Prime bone-in ribeye, dry-aged in house for at least three weeks, is among the standout staples at B&B Butchers on Washington Avenue. The USDA Prime bone-in ribeye, dry-aged in house for at least three weeks, is among the standout staples at B&B Butchers on Washington Avenue. Photo: Dave Rossman, Freelance Image 2 of 15 B&B Butchers & Restaurant, 1814 Washington, is a retail butcher shop and upscale steakhouse in the historic former Dittman Bakery. B&B Butchers & Restaurant, 1814 Washington, is a retail butcher shop and upscale steakhouse in the historic former Dittman Bakery. Photo: Melissa Phillip, Houston Chronicle Image 3 of 15 The upstairs dining room at B&B Butchers & Restaurant. The upstairs dining room at B&B Butchers & Restaurant. Photo: Melissa Phillip, Houston Chronicle Image 4 of 15 Owner Benjamin Berg poses at B&B Butchers & Restaurant. Owner Benjamin Berg poses at B&B Butchers & Restaurant. Photo: Melissa Phillip, Houston Chronicle Image 5 of 15 B&B Butchers & Restaurant, 1814 Washington, is a retail butcher shop and upscale steakhouse in the historic former Dittman Bakery. B&B Butchers & Restaurant, 1814 Washington, is a retail butcher shop and upscale steakhouse in the historic former Dittman Bakery. Photo: Melissa Phillip, Houston Chronicle Image 6 of 15 The carpet bagger of fried oyster and filet mignon tips at B&B Butchers & Restaurant. The carpet bagger of fried oyster and filet mignon tips at B&B Butchers & Restaurant. Photo: Melissa Phillip, Houston Chronicle Image 7 of 15 Dry aged porter house steaks at B&B Butchers & Restaurant. Dry aged porter house steaks at B&B Butchers & Restaurant. Photo: Melissa Phillip, Houston Chronicle Image 9 of 15 The B&B "Steak" House Salad The B&B "Steak" House Salad Photo: Melissa Phillip, Houston Chronicle Image 10 of 15 The restaurant sports a view of downtown from its rooftop patio. The restaurant sports a view of downtown from its rooftop patio. Image 11 of 15 The tomato and onion salad at B&B Butchers. The tomato and onion salad at B&B Butchers. Photo: Dave Rossman, Freelance Image 12 of 15 The gin & tonic on tap at B&B Butchers. The gin & tonic on tap at B&B Butchers. Photo: Dave Rossman, Freelance Image 13 of 15 A gin & tonic at B&B Butchers. A gin & tonic at B&B Butchers. Photo: Dave Rossman, Freelance Image 14 of 15 The upstairs dining room and outdoor balcony iat B&B Butchers & Restaurant. The upstairs dining room and outdoor balcony iat B&B Butchers & Restaurant. Photo: Melissa Phillip, Staff Image 15 of 15 Review: At B&B Butchers, some steakhouse classics sizzle, others fizzle 1 / 15 Back to Gallery B&B Butchers & Restaurant
One star
The upscale steakhouse in this gorgeously rehabbed 1924 bakery has a rare sense of place, genuinely warm hospitality and dizzying skyline views from its upstairs bar and dining deck. Enough steakhouse classics shine that it's well worth cherry-picking the standouts from an erratically executed menu. (There's plenty of potential here for another star down the line.) Note that owner Benjamin Berg, a former general manager at Houston's Smith & Wollensky, has installed a nifty butcher shop in front, where home cooks can purchase some top-of-the-line steaks dry-aged in house along with fat deli sandwiches to eat in or take out.
Must-orders: Chef Tommy's Bacon with Roquefort and truffle honey; shrimp cocktail; tomato and onion salad with Russian dressing; wedge salad; Carpet Bagger fried oysters; crab Louie salad; dry-aged ribeye; dry-aged porterhouse for two; creamed spinach; New York cheesecake; apple crisp.
Read the full review here .
Media: Gopher // B&B Butchers & Restaurant Owner Benjamin Berg talks about his newly opened restaurant. (Video produced by Dylan Aguilar) Details:
1814 Washington Avenue
713-862-1814
Hours: L&D daily: Monday — Wednesday 11 a.m. — 11 p.m.; Thursday — Saturday 11 a.m. —midnight; Sunday 11 a.m. — 10 p.m.
Credit cards: all major
Prices: starters $9 — $20; entrees $21 — $80 (lunch $14 — $44) ; sides $8 — $16); desserts $9
